law.text: If all the persons nominated as executors are under the age of eighteen (18) at the time of probating the will, or those who are of age fail to qualify, administration with the will annexed may be granted during such minority. But if a testator, by his will, so directs, then such infant executor may qualify and give bond as an adult.
law.history: Amended 1968 Ky. Acts ch. 100, sec. 11. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 3893.
